ARABIC: يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ بِنِعْمَةٍ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَفَضْلٍ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: rejoicing in blessings and favour from Allah and that Allah does not let the wage of the muminun go to waste.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They rejoice at the kindness and mercy of God; and God does not suffer the wages of the faithful to go waste.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They rejoice at the favours and bounties of Allah, and at the awareness that Allah will not cause the reward of the believers to be lost.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: that they will be rewarded with bounties and favors from their Lord and that God will not neglect the reward of the true believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They rejoice because of the favours from Allah and (His) munificence, and because Allah does not waste the reward of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They rejoice in a grace and a bounty from Allah, and that Allah will not waste the reward of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They rejoice on account of favor from Allah and (His) grace, and that Allah will not waste the reward of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: joyful in blessing and bounty from God, and that God leaves not to waste the wage of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They rejoice because of favour from Allah and kindness, and that Allah wasteth not the wage of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: rejoicing in God's grace and bounty. [They know that] God will not fail to requite the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They rejoice at the favour of Allah and His grace, and that verily Allah wasteth not the hire of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They rejoice in Allah’s blessing and grace, and that Allah does not waste the reward of the faithful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They glory in the Grace and the bounty from Allah, and in the fact that Allah suffereth not the reward of the Faithful to be lost (in the least).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They rejoice in a Grace and a Bounty from Allah, and that Allah will not waste the reward of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: having glad tidings of a Favor and Bounty from Allah. Allah will not waste the wage of the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They rejoice in grace from God, and bounty, and that God will not waste the reward of the faithful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They receive good tidings of favor from Allah and bounty and [of the fact] that Allah does not allow the reward of believers to be lost -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [3:171] Joyful in grace, in the reward, and bounty, in addition to it, from God, and that (read wa-anna as a supplement to ni‘matin, or wa-inna to denote a new clause) God does not let the wage of believers go to waste, but rewards them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They rejoice because of favour from Allah) because of a reward from Allah (and kindness) and honour, (and that Allah wasteth not) thwarts not (the wage of the believers) regarding jihad, i.e. that which befalls them in the course of jihad.
